description: The 48-year-old took a jab at Steve Harvey by jokingly naming Straight Outta Compton as the winner for Best Score at the Golden Globe Awards show on Sunday.
title: Jamie Foxx announces the wrong Golden Globes 2016 best score winner
title_page: Jamie Foxx announces the wrong Golden Globes 2016 best score winner | Daily Mail Online
text:
Jamie Foxx decided to take a jab at Steve Harvey and his now infamous Miss Universe blunder while at the 73rd annual Golden Globe Awards.
The 48-year-old jokingly named Straight Outta Compton as the winner for the category, Best Original Score for a motion picture, while presenting at the awards show on Sunday in Beverly Hills.
Before opening the envelope, the actor said: 'And the winner is...Straight Outta Compton,' even though the the film was not nominated.
Scroll down for video
All in fun: Jamie Foxx decided to take a jab at Steve Harvey and his now infamous Miss Universe blunder while presenting at the 73rd annual Golden Globe Awards with actress Lily James
In December, Steve mistakenly named Miss Colombia, Ariadna Gutierrez, as Miss Universe instead of the winner, Miss Philippines' Pia Wurtzbach.
Jamie's co-presenter, actress Lily James, burst into laughter as he apologized.
Jamie said: 'I'm sorry folks, I made a mistake. It's right here on the card. I take full responsibility. It was right here on the card. I apologize to everyone in Compton. I apologize to Ice Cube.'
The singer held up the envelope to show the audience and the camera the winner's name.
On accident: Steve mistakingly named Miss Colombia, Ariadna Gutierrez, as Miss Universe instead of the winner, Miss Philippines' Pia Wurtzbach; Steve pictured at the 2015 Miss Universe Pageant in December
Having a laugh: The 48-year-old masterfully mocked the Miss Universe host's mix-up
He handed the envelope to Lily, who announced Ennio Morricone for The Hateful Eight as the winner of Best Score.
After the live blunder in December, Steve explained how the mistake happened during an episode of his radio show last week.
He said on the Steve Harvey Morning Show: 'Here's the situation: now, when the mistake was made, when I said the wrong woman's name, I can only give information I had.
'No one knows, and that information is not in the teleprompter because you've got two women standing there. I read what was on the teleprompter, then I read what was on the card.'
Comical side: His co-presenter, actress Lily James, burst into laughter as he apologized
For a joke: The singer held up the envelope to show the audience and the camera the winner's name
The three amigos: Jamie later posed up with fellow stars Will Smith and Denzel Washington
